article.headline: Next raises guidance after swinging to a loss
article.body: Next PLC reported Thursday a swing to pretax loss for the first half of fiscal 2021 and said that its guidance for the full year has improved significantly. The FTSE 100-listed clothing and home-furnishings retailer posted a pretax loss for the six months ended July 25 of 16.5 million pounds ($21.4 million) compared with profit of GBP327.4 million a year earlier. Revenue for the period fell to GBP1.29 billion from GBP2.01 billion. Retail sales contributed GBP344.6 million compared with GBP874.3 million a year earlier, while online sales contributed GBP862.6 million, down from GBP1.00 billion. The board doesn't intend to pay an interim dividend in the year to Jan. 2021, it added. "Full price sales at the beginning of the second half have continued to exceed our expectations and we have revised our central scenario for full year profit, up from GBP195 million to GBP300 million," Next said.
